bug.short_desc: Restoring initial header widths for auto-resizable columns after hiding and showing the table

long_desc.thetext: Mass move of bugs to target 0.7.3

Dioc, I could not reproduce this behavior using your sample code together with qooxdoo 0.7.2. In Firefox, Internet Explorer, Safari and Opera the whole table is re-renderd using the inital width values for headers and cells. Could you try again using the latest legacy version or provide another example showing the bug?

Fixed by r10955.
Although, like Jonathan, I did not see headers being resized wiithout column data, it was a mistake to allow any resizing upon a "redisplay" of a previously rendered table.
The default table column resize model initializes the column widths upon the "appear" event. If the table is hidden -- e.g. by being placed in a pageview and the page switched -- and then made visible again, another "appear" event is generated. Typically we won't want any manually adjusted column widths to be modified.
This checkin adds a new boolean property, "inintializeWidthsOnEveryAppear". Its default value is false (breaking backward compatibility but yielding the commonly desired result).
